word: Through long years of wearisome and comfortless striving, —years of rigorous self-denial, of reproach and humiliation, —Wesley had steadfastly adhered to his one purpose of seeking God. Now he had found him; and he found that the grace which he had toiled to win by prayers and fasts, by almsdeeds and self-abnegation, was a gift, “without money, and without price.”
